alert.note: Alert for Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 7:05PM CDT until October 12 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Lauderdale County in east central Mississippi... * Until 1000 PM CDT. * At 705 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Meridian, Zero, Increase, Savoy and Meehan. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
